item.title: New Statue Trouble
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Like Reaper said, you have to add it under the switch statement.

[code] public void objectClick(int objectID, int objectX, int objectY, int face, int face2, int GateID) {

    if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("admin")) {
        println_debug(
                "atObject: " + objectX + "," + objectY + " objectID: "
                + objectID);
    } 

    switch (objectID) {[/code]

So you would add it under

switch (objectID) {

item.title: New Statue Trouble
item.dc:creator: @zoro35 zoro35
item.description:
@zoro35 wrote:

Firstly, Saradomin is 2873, Guthix is 2875 and Zamorak is 2874. Try this…

case 2873: // Saradomin
            if (actionTimer == 0)    
                addSkillXP(40000, 0); 
                addItem(995, 17500); 
                sendMessage("You Gain Attack Experience!");
                setAnimation(733); // Animation
                actionTimer = 10;
                updateRequired = true;
                appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
                break;

	   case 2875: // Guthix
            if (actionTimer == 0)    
                addSkillXP(60000, 1); 
                addItem(995, 10000); 
                sendMessage("You Gain Def3nce Xp.");   
                setAnimation(733); // Animation
                actionTimer = 10;
                updateRequired = true;
                appearanceUpdateRequired = true
                break;

	   case 2874: // Zamorak
            if (actionTimer == 0)    
                addSkillXP(50000, 2); 
                addItem(995, 15000); 
                sendMessage("You Gain Some Strength Xp.");   
                setAnimation(733); // Animation
                actionTimer = 10;
                updateRequired = true;
                appearanceUpdateRequired = true; 
                break;

Replace all three of your cases with this. If this doesnt work I’ll give up… Also add these cases in ‘/* OBJECT CLICK ONE*/’

Read full topic

item.title: New Statue Trouble
item.dc:creator: @x_m_1_k_3_x x m 1 k 3 x
item.description:
@x_m_1_k_3_x wrote:

You must add them under the object Clicking packets. I don’t know them by heart, but most likely it will be like…

public void objectClickOne(integers....) {

Also, the integers…thing I added that because my integers might be different then yours, but I am at a mates house so I don’t know. Another thing, do those animation ID’s even support the cache? Because if they are to high, they will crash the cache loading a corrupted account since mostly likely your server is multi-threaded…

item.title: New Statue Trouble

item.description:
@Elvemage_0o wrote:

Im trying to code in the saradomin = attack xp

zamorak = str xp

guthix = defence xp

and these are my codes

attackcase 2873: if(actionTimer == 0) { sendMessage("You train Attack !"); actionTimer = 20; setAnimation(2068); addSkillXP((0101*playerLevel[0]), 0); addSkillXP((0101*playerLevel[3]), 3); updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; } break;

Strength

case 2874: if(actionTimer == 0) { sendMessage("You train Strength !"); actionTimer = 20; setAnimation(2555); addSkillXP((0101*playerLevel[2]), 2); addSkillXP((0101*playerLevel[3]), 3); updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; } break;

and last but not least Defence

case 2875: if(actionTimer == 0) { sendMessage("You train Def !"); actionTimer = 20; setAnimation(1978); addSkillXP((0101*playerLevel[3]), 3); addSkillXP((0101*playerLevel[1]), 1); updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; } break;

where do i add this

i kno in client.java but where
